      void DropBlock​(BlockModel blockModel)
      Checks all blocks for a connector link and adds the blockModel in the correct position, then reorders the blocks and adapts the scrollbar.

      Gets the next BlockModel to execute and calls execute on it
      void GenerateProgram()
      Clears the current program Generates a new one if all conditions are met: - Only one group of blocks (except function definitions) - Iterate through the blocks and add them to the program (don't handle bodies)

      React to a MouseDrag on (x,y): Passes the call along to the scrollbar
      void HandleMousePress​(int x, int y)
      React to a MousePress on (x,y): checks all the blocks to find the one being pressed set the dragged block in the GameController remove the block from the program area data if no block was pressed, pass the call along to the scrollbar

      React to a MouseRelease on (x,y): Passes the call along to the scrollbar

        public void GenerateProgram()
        Clears the current program Generates a new one if all conditions are met: - Only one group of blocks (except function definitions) - Iterate through the blocks and add them to the program (don't handle bodies)
